text:
I’m sure you’re doing a great job preparing
for IELTS test and you will be looking

for some tips to improve your IELT’S score.
So todays lesson will be all about these tips

for IELT’S specifically for listening. Welcome
to my new class. My name is Emmelda and we

will be discussing few tips or pointers, which
are very important and are recommended by

the British Council members themselves. So
let’s take a look at few tips. Tip number

one, Instructions. Sometimes people have the
tendency to go straight to the question before

reading it. This is a place where a lot of
students make mistakes. Why? Because some

questions will have instructions saying that,
no more than three words. In questions like

this which has instruction so specific, even
if you add one more word. You will lose the

score. So please be very careful, read the
instruction first before you head on to the

question. The second tip would be, Time. There
are various phrases to describe time, I’m

sure you would have heard some. Let me give
you few examples, have you heard of the phrase

quarter two, half past, ten minutes to five?
These are ways to describe time. Now this

is where people loose scores as well. For
example, if the phrase says quarter to eight.

The time actually means seven forty five.
But someone who’s listening to the audio

clip and he listens to quarter to eight, he
may only focus on number eight and may write

eight o’clock. This is wrong because quarter
to eight means seven forty five and not eight

o’clock. Moving on to the third tip, the
writing skills. This test IELT’S listening

is about your listening skills, no doubt about
it. However you will be tested on your grammar,

your sentence frame work as well as your spellings.
If you make a mistake in either of these three,

you will be losing your score. So be very
careful while you are writing. Anyways you

will be given sometime when you are transferring
your answers, so take a moment before you

write something and be very sure of what you
are writing. The forth tip is the Abbreviation.

A lot of students don’t know about this,
if you want to write your answer using abbreviation,

it is fine, but you have to look for very
standard abbreviation. For example, if you

want to talk about thirty seconds or ten seconds.
It’s okay if you write ten sec, because

sec is a standard abbreviation for IELT’S
British Council members. However if you write

ten s, this is wrong. They will not be able
to accept this answer, so you have to be very

careful. My recommendation would be write
the full word thirty ten seconds. You will

save a lot of, I will not say, you will save
a lot of time, but you will improve your chances

to get a higher score. The next tip is practice
test. There are some people who are very confident

with English and say, Yeah I’ve been living
in that country for so long, I can do this.

Good for you, do it. However practice makes
man perfect. So practice as much as you can

as you never know, you may be improving your
level of ability in English a little higher

then what you have. And it is a good thing,
so practice as much as you can. The next and

the most important tip is tricky twist. You
will have audio clips with portions where

they will be going back and forth with the
same information. For example, someone would

be saying, hi lets meet at 10 pm and if you
have a question, which says, what time have

decided to meet? And if you answer just based
on this sentence, let’s meet at 10 pm and

you write 10 pm, be watchful, because this
is where the twist comes, the other person

may say, Oh no I can’t, lets meet at nine
fifty , so you’ll write again nine fifty.

Then I say no nono I can’t do it, let’s
meet at ten thirty, that will be fine. So

your final answer is ten thirty. If you are
not able to get this information and the moment

you write, the moment you finish listening
to 10 pm, some people tend to go to the next

questionimmediately without listening clearly
and this is where you become wrong. So hold

on to that question, while the information
on your audio is still running. If they are

talking about the meeting, let them finish
the topic on meeting, before you move on to

the next question. So tricky twist are very
very tricky and be very careful. The next

tip would be, Teen vs. Ty. What do I mean
by that? It means some people get confused

when you are talking about numbers, you don’t
know are they talking about fifteen or are

they talking about fifty. This requires practice;
you have to practice over and over again to

get the right answer. The only trick or the
only tip I would say is, whenever the number

ends with teen, the focus would be at the
last part, fifteen. So focus is on teen, however

whenever the number ends with ty, for example,
fifty. The focus or the stress is at the first

part of the word or the number, so if you’re
hearing lets have fifteen glasses of juices,

focus where is the stress is it the last or
the first half of the number? Teen, the stress

will be on teen. Fifty, the stress will be
on the first half which is fifty. The next

one we have is, Clues. You will have your
question paper ahead of you for you even before

you start hearing your audio clips. So as
soon as you get the question paper, please

take a moment go through the question clearly
and try to find out words that will give you

clues on what the audio clip will be all about.
Now clues could mean synonyms, when you’re

talking about, let’s say request. What did
the person request? Request have other words,

what did the person ask for, so use those
words as your clues and understand, what the

audio clip might be? And at what areas can
you get your answers? So these are the tips

that are recommended by The British Council
members themselves and it is very useful.

I would recommend all of you to take a note
of all these points. I hope this video was

useful to you, you’ve learnt something new?
And all the best for your IELT’S examination.

I will be coming back soon with a new lesson
on reading, writing or speaking. But I will

be back soon, till then have fun, stay healthy
and wish you best of luck. Goodbye.
